law.catch_line: In connection with property on which it holds a mortgage, the Administration may:...

section.section:
In an action under this subsection, the Administration may:
complete, administer, and pay the principal of and interest on an obligation incurred in connection with the property; and
dispose of and otherwise deal with the property, so as to protect the interests of the Administration.
This subsection does not apply to a lien held in connection with a public purpose project.

The Administration may not lend money on the security of property unless the lien on the property is superior to all other liens, except for:
a lien for taxes owed to the State or a political subdivision; or
an earlier mortgage lien.
At public or private sale and with or without public bidding, the Administration may sell a mortgage or other obligation that the Administration holds.
The Administration may retain the servicing rights and charge servicing fees for any mortgage or other obligation the Administration sells.
